subtitle: These lightly baked mousses make a spectacular starter for a dinner party accompanied with decorative carrot salad.

method.text: Steam the parsnips and carrots separately for 10-20 min or until tender. Allow to cool slightly.

Put the parsnip, half the butter, Gorgonzola cheese, half the lemon juice and half the breadcrumbs in a food processor. Blend until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Beat in half the cream and one egg yolk.

Put the carrot, remaining butter, remaining lemon juice and breadcrumbs, cream cheese and ground almonds in the food processor. Blend until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Beat in remaining cream and egg yolk.
Season both mixtures. Whisk the egg whites until stiff. Fold half into each mixture.
Spoon the carrot puree between individual lightly greased and base lined dariole moulds. Smooth the surface and top with the parsnip puree.

Place the dishes in a roasting pan. Pour in enough boiling water to come <sup>2</sup>/<sub>3</sub> of the way up the sides of the dishes. Place in the oven for 15-20 min or until firm to touch. Remove from the oven and leave to rest for 5 min.
Meanwhile, prepare the carrot salad. Using a potato peeler, peel the carrots into long strips. Blend together oil, vinegar, parsley and seasoning. Toss with the carrots until coated.
To serve, turn out the mousses onto individual plates. Spoon the salad around them.

title: Creamy carrot, parsnip and gorgonzola mousse
